com.gamelanlabs.chimplecrowd.solvers

Class SamsaraSolver

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gamelanlabs.chimplecrowd.solvers.Solver
      • com.gamelanlabs.chimplecrowd.solvers.MetropolisHastingsSolver
        • com.gamelanlabs.chimplecrowd.solvers.SamsaraSolver
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Query

    public class SamsaraSolver
extends MetropolisHastingsSolver
    Hybridized traceMH + proportional death/particle filter population solver. During burn-in, the extra operator is applied with probability karma on each step. During sampling and spacing, the extra operator is never performed.
    Author:
    BenL

      A counter for the number of resampling steps that have passed.

      static byte MODE_FINAL_POPULATION
      MODE_FINAL_POPULATION Returns the final population.
      static byte MODE_TOP_HISTORY
      MODE_TOP_HISTORY Returns one sample per population in the population history (populationresults), selected deterministically by choosing the sample with the highest likelihood.
      static byte MODE_UNIFORM_HISTORY
      MODE_UNIFORM_HISTORY Returns one sample per population in the population history (populationresults), selected uniformly.
      static byte MODE_WEIGHTED_HISTORY
      MODE_WEIGHTED_HISTORY Returns one sample per population in the population history (populationresults), selected from a discrete distribution where each individual in a population is weighted by normalized likelihoods.
      java.util.ArrayList<java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Object>> populationresults
      The population history.

    • Field Detail

      • MODE_FINAL_POPULATION

        public static final byte MODE_FINAL_POPULATION
        MODE_FINAL_POPULATION Returns the final population. If you are using this mode, you should only pass burnin, popsize, and alpha -- samples and spacing should be set to zero. IMPORTANT: the number of samples returned in this mode will not be the "samples" argument to solve() -- it will be the "popsize" argument!
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MODE_UNIFORM_HISTORY

        public static final byte MODE_UNIFORM_HISTORY
        MODE_UNIFORM_HISTORY Returns one sample per population in the population history (populationresults), selected uniformly.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MODE_WEIGHTED_HISTORY

        public static final byte MODE_WEIGHTED_HISTORY
        MODE_WEIGHTED_HISTORY Returns one sample per population in the population history (populationresults), selected from a discrete distribution where each individual in a population is weighted by normalized likelihoods.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MODE_TOP_HISTORY

        public static final byte MODE_TOP_HISTORY
        MODE_TOP_HISTORY Returns one sample per population in the population history (populationresults), selected deterministically by choosing the sample with the highest likelihood. WARNING: This will not be a very good representation of the stationary distribution!
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • solve

        public void solve()
        Description copied from class: Solver
        The solver is invoked by calling this method. This abstract class requires that all subclasses must implement a no-argument version (ie. with default values for burnin, samples, etc.), but generally a with-arguments version will be called.
        Overrides:
        solve in class MetropolisHastingsSolver

      • solve

        public void solve(int burnin,
         int samples,
         int spacing)
        Description copied from class: MetropolisHastingsSolver
        Solve using traceMH.
        Overrides:
        solve in class MetropolisHastingsSolver
        Parameters:
        burnin - Number of "burn-in" samples to throw away initially. These won't be recorded in results[].
        samples - Number of samples.
        spacing - Number of samples to throw away between saved samples.
